attributes.action: Hold 2nd referendum on EU membership, once negotiated terms of withdrawal known
attributes.additional_details:
Those who voted "Leave" on June 23rd did so without knowing what the exact terms of withdrawal would be - and whether promises made on issues such as immigration, trade, NHS spending etc would be realised. 

Once negotiations have concluded (and terms/implications are clear), it's only fair that British people are allowed a vote on whether they want to Remain in/Leave the EU. 

This empowers the British people to make a more informed decision on the pros/cons of continued EU membership.
attributes.background:
Whilst we fully respect the collective will of the British people in voting to withdraw from the EU, the terms & implications of that withdrawal are not yet clear. 

Once negotiations have concluded, we request a second referendum to make a final, more fully informed decision on EU membership
